Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: Hi, I noticed there is a Hush3 repo on Github now. Should pools be using that daemon now for Hush, or is it still ok to be running the 2.0 hushd daemon ?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @dukeleto 👆🏽

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @newvulcan hush3 is not live yet, still tweaking chain params. Pools should stay on v2 until block 500,000

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also, if you use the latest dev branch, you can do `hushd -stopat=500000` to ensure your node stops at the snapshot height, if you want. I ported that from KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you can still do RPC commands, at that block height

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Lol and Verus ,  it has Verus hash2 right?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: VRSC only uses 200W iirc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i mine VRSC with mine, for a while

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: What algo is VBK

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not even sure

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I never even looked into loading that bitstream, not sure if it's only for hosted blackminers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they give out bitstreams to hosted miners first

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Ah, it will eventually make its way to the wild

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it took them about a month to react to Mike having his "coming of age" moment of realizing he couldn't prevent FPGA's from mining VRSC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they secretly mined at first

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then VRSC forked

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then HAC got a new bitstream in a few weeks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and VRSC realized the cat and mouse game was not theirs to win

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: VRSC did make their move, and made the ratios of CPU to GPU to FPGA miner something "more reasonable" than when FPGAs secretly mined

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but FPGA mining VRSC blows away CPU mining, still. If you are doing it for profit, as a business, it makes no sense to mine VRSC with a CPU. If you are just mining for fun or hobby, then you can still make a few pennies a day with a fancy CPU

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I will say that I do build CPU mining rigs, and you expect those to be able to mine various coins, so their lifecycle of use is different than ASICs or FPGAs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's smarter to mine Monero forks with CPU rigs, which aggressively go against GPUs and FPGAs

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I’m glad the monero crowd keeps forking,   Bitmain and others won’t put out another cryptonote miner because of it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: There are coins which are solo mining only CPU only, multiple ones

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they see pools as evil

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and constantly change their PoW so that a "middle of the road" decent CPU has a reasonable chance to find a block per week, something like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's an interesting and different world. Refreshing, after seeing to many coins doing exactly the same fucking things
